ploys.name: BOLTER DISCIPLINE
ploys.description: Until the end of the Turning Point, each time a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative is activated, if it does not perform a Fight action during that activation, it can perform two Shoot actions during that activation if a bolt weapon is selected for each of those shooting attacks. A bolt weapon is a ranged weapon that includes 'bolt' in its name, e.g. bolt carbine, special issue bolt pistol etc.

ploys.name: SHOCK ASSAULT
ploys.description: Until the end of the Turning Point, each time a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative is activated, if it does not perform a Shoot action during that activation, it can perform two Fight actions during that activation.

ploys.name: VANGUARD
ploys.description: Until the end of the Turning Point, each time a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative is activated, during that activation:
subTexts: It can ignore the first distance of 2' it travels for a climb, drop or traverse.
It automatically passes jump tests.
Add 1' to its Movement characteristic.

ploys.name: AND THEY SHALL KNOW NO FEAR
ploys.description: Until the end of the Turning Point:
subTexts: You can ignore any or all modifiers to the APL of friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operatives.
Friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operatives are not injured.

ploys.name: STEALTH ASSAULT
ploys.description: Use this Tactical Ploy when a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative with a Conceal order that is not within Engagement Range of an enemy operative is activated.
subTexts: That operative cannot make shooting attacks during that activation.

The first time that operative performs a Fight action during that activation, in the Resolve Successful Hits step of that combat, the first time you resolve one of your successful hits, you can immediately resolve another of your successful hits.

ability.name: Designer's Note
ability.description: Unless the operative can perform a Charge action while it has a Conceal order (e.g. the Assassin Battle Honour), when it is activated, you will need to change its order to Engage to use this Tactical Ploy.

ploys.name: TRANSHUMAN PHYSIOLOGY
ploys.description: Use this Tactical Ploy in the Roll Defence Dice step of a shooting attack, after rolling defence dice for a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative. You can retain one of your successful normal saves as a critical save instead.

ploys.name: ONE STEP AHEAD
ploys.description: Use this Tactical Ploy at the end of the Select a Kill Team step of the mission sequence, after kill teams have been revealed. You can remove one friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative from your kill team and add a different PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative to your kill team (adhering to the requirements of selecting your kill team). If both players have this or a similar ability, the Defender resolves this ability first.

ploys.name: ELITE RECONNAISSANCE
ploys.description: Use this Tactical Ploy at the end of the Scouting step of the mission sequence. Select one of the following (if both players have this or a similar ability, the Defender resolves this ability first):
subTexts: You can redeploy up to two friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operatives that are wholly within your drop zone as if it were the Set Up Operatives step of the mission sequence.
Select and resolve an additional scouting option. It must be a different option to your original selection, and initiative is still determined by your original selection.

equipments.name: GRAPNEL LAUNCHER
equipments.description: REIVER operative only. The operative gains the following ability for the battle:

ability.name: Grapnel Launcher
subText: Each time this operative ascends or descends a terrain feature while climbing, the first vertical distance of up to 6' it travels is counted as 2' for that climb.
This operative does not need to be within 1' of a physical and climbable part of a terrain feature in order to climb it.
Each time this operative drops, the intended location can be any vertical distance from the level it occupies.
Each time this operative drops, it counts any vertical distance it travels as half for that drop.

equipments.name: GRAV-CHUTE
equipments.description: REIVER operative only. The operative gains the following ability for the battle:

ability.name: Grav-chute
subText: During the mission sequence, after resolving your selected option in the Scouting step, if this operative is wholly within your drop zone, it can perform a Grav-chute insertion. If it does so, you can perform a free Normal Move action with this operative. For that action, it has a Movement characteristic of 4' and can FLY.

Each time this operative moves off a Vantage Point, for that move, it can move as though it can FLY, so long as it does not move higher than that Vantage Point and ends that move lower than that Vantage Point.

equipments.name: SMOKE GRENADE
equipments.description: The operative can perform the following action during the battle:

uniqueAction.name: SMOKE GRENADE
uniqueAction.description: Place the centre of one Smoke token on a point within 6' of this operative. That token creates an area of smoke with a 2' radius and unlimited upward height (but not below) measured from the centre of that token. Until the end of the Turning Point, an operative is not Visible if a Cover line drawn to it crosses an area of smoke. This operative can only perform this action once, and cannot perform this action while within Engagement Range of an enemy operative.

equipments.name: SHOCK GRENADE
equipments.description: The operative can perform the following action during the battle:

uniqueAction.name: SHOCK GRENADE
uniqueAction.description: Select one point on the killzone within 6' of this operative. Roll one D6 for each operative within 2' of that point, subtracting 1 from the result if that operative is not Visible to this operative. On a 4+, subtract 1 from that operative's APL. This operative can only perform this action once, and cannot perform this action while within Engagement Range of an enemy operative.

equipments.name: FRAG GRENADE
equipments.description: The operative is equipped with the following ranged weapon for the battle:

specialRules.name: Rng 6'
specialRules.description: Range. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, only operatives within x are a valid target, x is the distance after the weapon's Rng, e.g. Rng 6'. All other rules for selecting a valid target still apply.

specialRules.name: Blast 2'
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative performs a Shoot action and selects this weapon (or, in the case of profiles, this weapon's profile), after making the shooting attack against the target, make a shooting attack with this weapon (using the same profile) against each other operative Visible to and within X of the original target - each of them is a valid target and cannot be in Cover. X is the distance after the weapon's Blast, e.g. Blast 2'. An operative cannot make a shooting attack with this weapon by performing an Overwatch action.

specialRules.name: Indirect
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the select valid target step of that shooting attack, enemy operatives are not in Cover.

specialRules.name: Limited
specialRules.description: This weapon can only be selected for use once per battle. If the weapon has a special rule that would allow it to make more than one shooting attack for an action (e.g. Blast), make each of those attacks as normal.

equipments.name: KRAK GRENADE
equipments.description: The operative is equipped with the following ranged weapon for the battle. It cannot make a shooting attack with this weapon by performing an Overwatch action:

specialRules.name: Rng 6'
specialRules.description: Range. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, only operatives within x are a valid target, x is the distance after the weapon's Rng, e.g. Rng 6'. All other rules for selecting a valid target still apply.

specialRules.name: AP1
specialRules.description: Armour Penetration. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, subtract x from the Defence of the target for that shooting attack, x is the number after the weapon's AP, e.g. AP1. If two different APx special rules would be in effect for a shooting attack, they are not cumulative - the attacker selects which one to use.

specialRules.name: Indirect
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the select valid target step of that shooting attack, enemy operatives are not in Cover.

specialRules.name: Limited
specialRules.description: This weapon can only be selected for use once per battle. If the weapon has a special rule that would allow it to make more than one shooting attack for an action (e.g. Blast), make each of those attacks as normal.

equipments.name: THROWING KNIFE
equipments.description: The operative is equipped with the following ranged weapon for the battle:

specialRules.name: Rng 6'
specialRules.description: Range. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, only operatives within x are a valid target, x is the distance after the weapon's Rng, e.g. Rng 6'. All other rules for selecting a valid target still apply.

specialRules.name: Limited
specialRules.description: This weapon can only be selected for use once per battle. If the weapon has a special rule that would allow it to make more than one shooting attack for an action (e.g. Blast), make each of those attacks as normal.

specialRules.name: Silent
specialRules.description: While an operative has a Conceal order, it can perform Shoot actions if this is the ranged weapon (or weapon profile) that is selected for the shooting attack(s).

equipments.name: PURITY SEAL
equipments.description: The operative gains the following ability for the battle:

ability.name: Purity Seal
ability.description: Once per battle, when this operative is fighting in combat, making a shooting attack or a shooting attack is being made against it, you can use the Command Re-roll Tactical Ploy without spending any CP.

tacOps.name: SHOCK AND AWE
tacOps.description: You can reveal this Tac Op in the Reveal Tac Ops step of any Turning Point.
tacOps.firstCondition: At the end of any Turning Point, if friendly operatives control one or more objective markers that were controlled by enemy operatives at the start of the Turning Point, you score 1VP.
tacOps.secondCondition: If you achieve the first condition in any subsequent Turning Points, you score 1VP.

tacOps.name: SABOTEURS
tacOps.description: Reveal this Tac Op in the Target Reveal step of the first Turning Point. Starting with your opponent, alternate placing one of your Saboteur tokens in the killzone until three have been placed. Each time a player places a Saboteur token, it must be touching a terrain feature, more than 3' from the killzone edges, more than 6' from your drop zone and each of your other Saboteur tokens, and it must not be on a Vantage Point.
tacOps.firstCondition: If two or more of your Saboteur tokens are removed, you score 1VP.
tacOps.secondCondition: If three of your Saboteur tokens are removed, you score 1VP.
tacOps.subText: Friendly operatives can perform the Saboteurs mission action.

uniqueAction.name: SABOTEURS
uniqueAction.description: An operative can perform this action while within 1' of one of your Saboteur tokens. Unless the operative is a SABOTEUR or MINELAYER operative, an operative cannot perform this action while within Engagement Range of an enemy operative. If this action is performed, remove that Saboteur token.

tacOps.name: GUERRILLA TACTICS
tacOps.description: You can reveal this Tac Op in the Reveal Tac Ops step of any Turning Point.
tacOps.firstCondition: At the end of any Turning Point, if more enemy operatives were incapacitated than friendly operatives during that Turning Point, and more than half of your operatives have a Conceal order, you score 1VP.
tacOps.secondCondition: If you achieve the first condition in any subsequent Turning Points, you score 1VP.

availableDataslates.name: INTERCESSOR (WARRIOR)
availableDataslates.description: Space Marines equipped to fight as Intercessors lay down punishing volleys of fire from their bolt rifles. Their tactics and wargear are adaptable to countless situations, and they form the core of many Chapters' battle companies.

Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that shooting attack, if you retain any critical hits, the weapon gains the APx special rule for that shooting attack, x is the number after the weapon's P, e.g. P1.

availableDataslates.name: INTERCESSOR SERGEANT
availableDataslates.description: Intercessor Sergeants lead their brothers in levelling salvoes of firepower against targets in ever-changing kill zones. They often carry specialist weaponry into battle.

The second time you strike with a critical hit, subtract 1 from the target's APL.

availableDataslates.name: ASSAULT INTERCESSOR (WARRIOR)
availableDataslates.description: Protected by Mk X Tacticus armour, Assault Intercessors charge into the fray with their chainswords swinging and mass-reactive shells firing from heavy bolt pistols.

availableDataslates.name: ASSAULT INTERCESSOR SERGEANT
availableDataslates.description: Assault Intercessor Sergeants understand the optimal moment to unleash charges, and lead by example in melee by rending foes in twain with their chainswords.

availableDataslates.name: INCURSOR (WARRIOR)
availableDataslates.description: Incursors fulfil an aggressive, close-quarters gunfighting role within the Adeptus Astartes. Fed with targeting data from their backpack-mounted auspexes, they can detect their foes through dense smoke, atmospheric phenomena and even solid walls.

specialRules.name: No Cover
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, for that shooting attack, defence dice cannot be automatically retained as a result of Cover (they must be rolled instead).

specialRules.name: No Cover
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, for that shooting attack, defence dice cannot be automatically retained as a result of Cover (they must be rolled instead).

availableDataslates.name: INCURSOR SERGEANT
availableDataslates.description: Incursor Sergeants coordinate their team's multispectrum analyses, building predictive models of their opponents' fighting patterns. They lead their warriors in knife-fighting techniques and direct specialists in laying heavy-duty haywire mines to knock out enemy armour.

specialRules.name: No Cover

availableDataslates.name: INFILTRATOR WARRIOR
availableDataslates.description: The flexible armour worn by Infiltrators enables them to advance quickly and stealthily. They frequently attack behind enemy lines, disrupting communications and silencing key targets. Their omni-scramblers and unerring kill shots sow discord and fear among the foe.

specialRules.name: Lethal 5+
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative fights in combat or makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that combat or shooting attack, your attack dice results of equal to or greater than x that are successful hits are critical hits, x is the number after the weapon's Lethal, e.g. Lethal 5+.

availableDataslates.name: INFILTRATOR SERGEANT
availableDataslates.description: Sergeants of Infiltrator teams drill their charges in self-sufficiency and survival techniques, preparing them for extended missions without Chapter support. Patient and imaginative tacticians, they guide their brothers in outflanking manoeuvres and long-range reconnaissance.

availableDataslates.name: REIVER (WARRIOR)
availableDataslates.description: Reivers are rapid-insertion terror troops without compare. They wear Phobos armour that allows them to stalk their foes in silence, but when they strike, Reivers unleash shock grenades and sonic waves that emit amplified roars as they gut the foe with combat knives.

availableDataslates.name: REIVER SERGEANT
availableDataslates.description: Reiver Sergeants lead teams of skull-masked warriors in unpredictable shock assaults that spread terror through enemy lines. They meticulously plot their insertion strategies, whether advancing through tangled ruins or using grapnels to scale vast heights.

Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, subtract x from the Defence of the target for that shooting attack, x is the number after the weapon's AP, e.g. AP1. If two different APx special rules would be in effect for a shooting attack, they are not cumulative - the attacker selects which one to use.

availableDataslates.name: HEAVY INTERCESSOR (WARRIOR)
availableDataslates.description: Shielded by extremely thick armour, Heavy Intercessors are capable of securing key objectives and holding them against an onslaught of foes. They are immovable in defence, and their volleys of heavy firepower keep ail but the most foolhardy enemies at bay.

criticalHitSpecialRules.name: P1

Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that shooting attack, if you retain any critical hits, the weapon gains the APx special rule for that shooting attack, x is the number after the weapon's P, e.g. P1.

availableDataslates.name: HEAVY INTERCESSOR (HEAVY GUNNER)
availableDataslates.description: Heavy Intercessors are assigned even more powerful bolt weapons than their brothers. They are enormous, rapid-firing guns that leave a bloody trail of destruction.

specialRules.name: Heavy
specialRules.description: An operative cannot perform a Charge, Fall Back or Normal Move action in the same activation in which it performs a Shoot action with this ranged weapon.

specialRules.name: Fusillade
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative performs a Shoot action and selects this weapon, after selecting a valid target, you can select any number of other valid targets within 2' of the original target. Distribute your attack dice between the targets you have selected. availableDataslates.name: TACTICAL MARINE (WARRIOR)
availableDataslates.description: Dependable and flexible, Space Marines assigned to Tactical Squads are called upon to fulfil a wide range of battlefield roles. When armed with the boltgun, they can hold ground, provide fire support and unload suppressive salvoes while rapidly advancing.

availableDataslates.name: TACTICAL MARINE (GUNNER)
availableDataslates.description: Space Marines train with countless weapon types in support of their flexible role. Depending on the mission, they wield thermal weapons to melt armour, infantry-roasting flamers or ancient firearms that discharge dangerous energy.

specialRules.name: Rng 6'
specialRules.description: Range. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, only operatives within x are a valid target, x is the distance after the weapon's Rng, e.g. Rng 6'. All other rules for selecting a valid target still apply.

availableDataslates.description: These grizzled leaders have emerged victorious through countless battles. They are canny individuals, able to pick out the threats and opportunities of battle.

availableDataslates.name: SCOUT (WARRIOR)
availableDataslates.description: Scouts are Chapter recruits, part way through the genetic transformation to become full Space Marines. They conduct reconnaissance missions, commando raids, ambushes and sabotage runs, mastering the whole gamut of skills to be judged true battle brothers.

availableDataslates.name: SCOUT SERGEANT
availableDataslates.description: Throughout their field training, Scouts are instructed by their Sergeant. Commonly elder Space Marines, these Sergeants are the shepherds of the Chapter's future, exacting in their standards and ruthless in their pursuit of perfection from their wards.

availableDataslates.name: SCOUT SNIPER (WARRIOR)
availableDataslates.description: Scouts learn not only about unleashing their strength in the fury of melee, but also about the stoic patience of the precision killer. They regularly undertake missions of assassination and infiltration, and acquire the skills to stalk and strike unseen from afar as death incarnate.

availableDataslates.name: DEATHWATCH VETERAN (WARRIOR)
availableDataslates.description: Deathwatch kill teams comprise experienced warriors equipped with rare weapons and equipment, including specialist ammunition tailored to kill various xenos.

specialRules.name: No Cover
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, for that shooting attack, defence dice cannot be automatically retained as a result of Cover (they must be rolled instead).

criticalHitSpecialRules.name: Rending
criticalHitSpecialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative fights in combat or makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that combat or shooting attack, if you retain any critical hits you can retain one normal hit as a critical hit.

criticalHitSpecialRules.name: P1
criticalHitSpecialRules.description: Piercing. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that shooting attack, if you retain any critical hits, the weapon gains the APx special rule for that shooting attack, x is the number after the weapon's P, e.g. P1.

specialRules.name: Lethal 5+
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative fights in combat or makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that combat or shooting attack, your attack dice results of equal to or greater than x that are successful hits are critical hits, x is the number after the weapon's Lethal, e.g. Lethal 5+.

specialRules.name: Rng 3'
specialRules.description: Range. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, only operatives within x are a valid target, x is the distance after the weapon's Rng, e.g. Rng . All other rules for selecting a valid target still apply.

specialRules.name: Torrent 2'
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative performs a Shoot action or Overwatch action and selects this weapon, after making the shooting attack against the target, it can make a shooting attack with this weapon against each other valid target within x of the original target and each other, x is the distance after the weapon's Torrent, e.g. Torrent 2'.

availableDataslates.name: DEATHWATCH VETERAN (HEAVY GUNNER)
availableDataslates.description: These Deathwatch Veterans bear the most potent of xenos-killing firepower, and support kill teams facing especially dangerous horrors.

specialRules.name: Heavy
specialRules.description: An operative cannot perform a Charge, Fall Back or Normal Move action in the same activation in which it performs a Shoot action with this ranged weapon.

specialRules.name: Fusillade
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative performs a Shoot action and selects this weapon, after selecting a valid target, you can select any number of other valid targets within 2' of the original target. Distribute your attack dice between the targets you have selected. Make a shooting attack with this weapon (using the same profile) against each of the targets you have selected using the attack dice you have distributed to each of them.

specialRules.name: Heavy
specialRules.description: An operative cannot perform a Charge, Fall Back or Normal Move action in the same activation in which it performs a Shoot action with this ranged weapon.

specialRules.name: Fusillade
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative performs a Shoot action and selects this weapon, after selecting a valid target, you can select any number of other valid targets within 2' of the original target. Distribute your attack dice between the targets you have selected. Make a shooting attack with this weapon (using the same profile) against each of the targets you have selected using the attack dice you have distributed to each of them.

criticalHitSpecialRules.name: P1
criticalHitSpecialRules.description: Piercing. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that shooting attack, if you retain any critical hits, the weapon gains the APx special rule for that shooting attack, x is the number after the weapon's P, e.g. P1.

specialRules.name: Heavy
specialRules.description: An operative cannot perform a Charge, Fall Back or Normal Move action in the same activation in which it performs a Shoot action with this ranged weapon.

specialRules.name: AP1
specialRules.description: Armour Penetration. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, subtract x from the Defence of the target for that shooting attack, x is the number after the weapon's AP, e.g. AP1. If two different APx special rules would be in effect for a shooting attack, they are not cumulative - the attacker selects which one to use.

specialRules.name: Heavy
specialRules.description: An operative cannot perform a Charge, Fall Back or Normal Move action in the same activation in which it performs a Shoot action with this ranged weapon.

specialRules.name: Blast 2'
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative performs a Shoot action and selects this weapon (or, in the case of profiles, this weapon's profile), after making the shooting attack against the target, make a shooting attack with this weapon (using the same profile) against each other operative Visible to and within X of the original target - each of them is a valid target and cannot be in Cover. X is the distance after the weapon's Blast, e.g. Blast . An operative cannot make a shooting attack with this weapon by performing an Overwatch action.

availableDataslates.name: DEATHWATCH VETERAN WATCH SERGEANT
availableDataslates.description: Deathwatch Watch Sergeants are deadly combatants and tacticians who carry an array of specialist weapons and have an instinct for divining their preys next move.

specialRules.name: Rng 6'
specialRules.description: Range. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, only operatives within x are a valid target, x is the distance after the weapon's Rng, e.g. Rng 6'. All other rules for selecting a valid target still apply.

abilities.name: Storm Shield
abilities.description: If this operative is equipped with a storm shield:
subText: It has a 4+ invulnerable save.
Each time it fights in combat, in the Resolve Successful Hits step of that combat, each time it parries, two of your opponent's successful hits are discarded (instead of one).

specialRules.name: Lethal 5+
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative fights in combat or makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that combat or shooting attack, your attack dice results of equal to or greater than x that are successful hits are critical hits, x is the number after the weapon's Lethal, e.g. Lethal 5+.

specialRules.name: Rng 6'
specialRules.description: Range. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, only operatives within x are a valid target, x is the distance after the weapon's Rng, e.g. Rng 6'. All other rules for selecting a valid target still apply.

specialRules.name: Combi
specialRules.description: An operative equipped with this weapon is also equipped with a Deathwatch boltgun.

ploys.name: BOLTER DISCIPLINE
ploys.description: Until the end of the Turning Point, each time a friendly SPACE MARINE operative (excluding a SCOUT operative) is activated, if it does not perform a Fight action during that activation, it can perform two Shoot actions during that activation if a bolt weapon is selected for each of those shooting attacks. A bolt weapon is a ranged weapon that includes 'bolt' in its name, e.g. boltgun, heavy bolter etc. In the case of the infernus heavy bolter, it must be the heavy bolter profile that is selected.

ploys.name: SHOCK ASSAULT
ploys.description: Until the end of the Turning Point, each time a friendly SPACE MARINE operative (excluding a SCOUT operative) is activated, if it does not perform a Shoot action during that activation, it can perform two Fight actions during that activation.

ploys.name: TACTICAL PRECISION
ploys.description: Until the end of the Turning Point, while a friendly SPACE MARINE operative is within 3' of and Visible to a friendly LEADER operative, each time it fights in combat or makes a shooting attack, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that combat or shooting attack, you can re-roll one of your attack dice.

ploys.name: TRANSHUMAN PHYSIOLOGY
ploys.description: Use this Tactical Ploy in the Roll Defence Dice step of a shooting attack, after rolling defence dice for a friendly PRIMARIS operative. You can change one of your retained normal saves to a critical save.

ploys.name: ONLY IN DEATH DOES DUTY END
ploys.description: Use this Tactical Ploy when a ready friendly SPACE MARINE operative is incapacitated. That operative is not removed from the killzone until the end of your next activation or the end of the battle (whichever comes first) and does not count as being injured.

ploys.name: AND THEY SHALL KNOW NO FEAR
ploys.description: Use this Tactical Ploy when a friendly SPACE MARINE operative is activated. Until the end of that operative's activation, you can ignore any or all modifiers to its APL characteristic and it is not injured.

ploys.name: OMNI-SCRAMBLER
ploys.description: Use this Tactical Ploy at the start of the Firefight phase. Select one enemy operative Visible to and within 6' of a friendly INFILTRATOR operative. Until the end of the Turning Point, that enemy operative cannot be activated until another enemy operative has been activated (unless it is the only remaining enemy operative).

ploys.name: MULTI-SPECTRUM ARRAY
ploys.description: Use this Tactical Ploy when a friendly INCURSOR operative performs a Shoot action. For that action's shooting attack, enemy operatives are not Obscured.

ploys.name: TERROR TROOP
ploys.description: Use this Tactical Ploy during a friendly REIVER operative's activation. Until the start of the next Turning Point:
subTexts: Each time an enemy operative would perform a mission action or the Pick Up action, if this friendly REIVER operative is within 3' of that enemy operative, one additional action point must be subtracted to perform that action.
When determining control of an objective marker that friendly REIVER operative is within range of, treat enemy operatives' total APL as being I less. Note that this is not a modifier.

equipments.name: AUXILIARY GRENADE LAUNCHER
equipments.description: INTERCESSOR operative only. The operative gains the following ability for the battle:

ability.name: Auxiliary Grenade Launcher
ability.description: Frag and krak grenades the operative is equipped with can be selected for use twice, instead of once. Each time the operative performs a Shoot action, if a frag or krak grenade is selected as the ranged weapon, an auxiliary grenade launcher can also be selected. If it is, for that action's shooting attack(s), frag or krak grenades are treated as not having the Rng 6' and Indirect special rules.

equipments.name: HELIX GAUNTLET
equipments.description: INFILTRATOR WARRIOR operative only. The operative gains the MEDIC keyword until the start of the next battle and can perform the following action during the battle:

uniqueAction.name: HELIX GAUNTLET
uniqueAction.description: Select one friendly SPACE MARINE operative Visible to and within 1' of this operative. That operative regains 2D3 lost wounds. This operative cannot perform this action while within Engagement Range of enemy operatives.

equipments.name: SMOKE GRENADE
equipments.description: INCURSOR, INFILTRATOR, REIVER or SCOUT operative only. The operative can perform the following action during the battle:

uniqueAction.name: SMOKE GRENADE
uniqueAction.description: Place the centre of one Smoke token on a point within 6' of this operative. That token creates an area of smoke with a 2' radius and unlimited upward height (but not below) measured from the centre of that token. Until the end of the Turning Point, an operative is Obscured if every Cover line drawn to it crosses an area of smoke. This operative can only perform this action once, and cannot perform this action while within Engagement Range of enemy operatives.

equipments.name: HAYWIRE MINE
equipments.description: INCURSOR WARRIOR operative only. The operative can perform the following action during the battle:

uniqueAction.name: HAYWIRE MINE
uniqueAction.description: Place a Haywire Mine token within 1' of this operative. This operative can only perform this action once, and cannot perform this action while within Engagement Range of enemy operatives. If this operative is incapacitated and removed from the killzone, remove its Haywire Mine token.
subText: The operative is equipped with the following ranged weapon:

specialRules.name: Detonate
specialRules.description: Each time this operative makes a Shoot action using its haywire mine, make a shooting attack against each operative within 3' of the centre of its Haywire Mine token with that weapon. When making those shooting attacks, each operative is treated as being Visible, but when determining if it is in Cover, treat this operative's Haywire Mine token as the active operative. Then remove this operative's Haywire Mine token. An operative cannot make a shooting attack with this weapon by performing an Overwatch action, or if its Haywire Mine token is not in the killzone.

specialRules.name: Silent
specialRules.description: While an operative has a Conceal order, it can perform Shoot actions if this is the ranged weapon (or weapon profile) that is selected for the shooting attack(s).

criticalHitSpecialRules.name: Stun
criticalHitSpecialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that shooting attack, if you retain any critical hits, subtract 1 from the target's APL. Each time a friendly operative fights in combat with this weapon, in the Resolve Successful Hits step of that combat:() The first time you strike with a critical hit, select one of your opponent's normal hits from that combat to be discarded. ()The second time you strike with a critical hit, subtract 1 from the target's APL.

equipments.name: SHOCK GRENADE
equipments.description: REIVER operative only. The operative can perform the following action during the battle:

uniqueAction.name: SHOCK GRENADE
uniqueAction.description: Select one point on the killzone within 6' of this operative. Roll one D6 for each operative within 2' of that point, subtracting 1 from the result if they are not Visible to this operative. On a 4+, subtract 1 from that operative's APL. This operative can only perform this action once, and cannot perform this action while within Engagement Range of enemy operatives.

equipments.name: FRAG GRENADE
equipments.description: The operative is equipped with the following ranged weapon for the battle:

specialRules.name: Rng 6'
specialRules.description: Range. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, only operatives within x are a valid target, x is the distance after the weapon's Rng, e.g. Rng 6'. All other rules for selecting a valid target still apply.

specialRules.name: Limited
specialRules.description: This weapon can only be selected for use once per battle. If the weapon has a special rule that would allow it to make more than one shooting attack for an action (e.g. Blast), make each of those attacks as normal.

specialRules.name: Blast 2'
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative performs a Shoot action and selects this weapon (or, in the case of profiles, this weapon's profile), after making the shooting attack against the target, make a shooting attack with this weapon (using the same profile) against each other operative Visible to and within X of the original target - each of them is a valid target and cannot be in Cover. X is the distance after the weapon's Blast, e.g. Blast 2'. An operative cannot make a shooting attack with this weapon by performing an Overwatch action.

specialRules.name: Indirect
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the select valid target step of that shooting attack, enemy operatives are not in Cover.

equipments.name: KRAK GRENADE
equipments.description: The operative is equipped with the following ranged weapon for the battle. It cannot make a shooting attack with this weapon by performing an Overwatch action:

specialRules.name: Rng 6'
specialRules.description: Range. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, only operatives within x are a valid target, x is the distance after the weapon's Rng, e.g. Rng 6'. All other rules for selecting a valid target still apply.

specialRules.name: Limited
specialRules.description: This weapon can only be selected for use once per battle. If the weapon has a special rule that would allow it to make more than one shooting attack for an action (e.g. Blast), make each of those attacks as normal.

specialRules.name: AP1
specialRules.description: Armour Penetration. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, subtract x from the Defence of the target for that shooting attack, x is the number after the weapon's AP, e.g. AP1. If two different APx special rules would be in effect for a shooting attack, they are not cumulative - the attacker selects which one to use.

specialRules.name: Indirect
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the select valid target step of that shooting attack, enemy operatives are not in Cover.

equipments.name: PURITY SEAL
equipments.description: The operative gains the following ability for the battle:

ability.name: Purity Seal
ability.description: Once per battle, when this operative is fighting in combat, making a shooting attack or a shooting attack is being made against it, you can use the Command Re-roll Tactical Ploy without spending any CP.

equipments.name: SUSPENSOR SYSTEM
equipments.description: The operative gains the following ability for the battle:

ability.name: Suspensor System
ability.description: The Heavy special rule of ranged weapons the operative is equipped with is treated differently. Instead, an operative cannot move more than 6' in the same activation in which it performs a Shoot action with any of those ranged weapons.

equipments.name: GRAPNEL LAUNCHER
equipments.description: REIVER operative only. The operative gains the following ability for the battle:

ability.name: Grapnel Launcher
subText: Each time this operative ascends or descends a terrain feature while climbing, the first vertical distance of up to 6' it travels is counted as 2' for that climb.
This operative does not need to be within 1' of a physical and climbable part of a terrain feature in order to climb it.
Each time this operative drops, the intended location can be any vertical distance from the level it occupies.
Each time this operative drops, it counts any vertical distance it travels as half for that drop.

equipments.name: GRAV-CHUTE
equipments.description: REIVER operative only. The operative gains the following ability for the battle:

ability.name: Grav-chute
subText: During the mission sequence, after resolving your selected option in the Scouting step, if this operative is wholly within your drop zone, it can perform a Grav-chute insertion. If it does so, you can perform a free Normal Move action with this operative. For that action, it has a Movement characteristic of 4' and can FLY.

Each time this operative moves off a Vantage Point, for that move, it can move as though it can FLY, so long as it does not move higher than that Vantage Point and ends that move lower than that Vantage Point.

equipments.name: AUSPEX
equipments.description: The operative can perform the following action during the battle:

uniqueAction.name: AUSPEX
uniqueAction.description: Select one friendly SPACE MARINE operative within 3' of and Visible to this operative. Until the end of the Turning Point, that operative's ranged weapons are treated as having the No Cover special rule. This operative cannot perform this action while within Engagement Range of enemy operatives.

availableDataslates.name: BLOODLETTER (FIGHTER)
availableDataslates.description: Bloodletters are Khorne's most numerous warriors, the foot soldiers of the Blood Legions. Their skin is the colour of spilt gore, and their muscles bulge in response to their rage. They carry jagged hellblades in their taloned hands that glow with the energies of the warp.

abilities.name: Daemon
abilities.description: This operative has a 5+ invulnerable save.

specialRules.name: Lethal 5+
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative fights in combat or makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that combat or shooting attack, your attack dice results of equal to or greater than x that are successful hits are critical hits, x is the number after the weapon's Lethal, e.g. Lethal 5+.

specialRules.name: Lethal 5+
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative fights in combat or makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that combat or shooting attack, your attack dice results of equal to or greater than x that are successful hits are critical hits, x is the number after the weapon's Lethal, e.g. Lethal 5+.

availableDataslates.name: BLOODLETTER (ICON BEARER)
availableDataslates.description: Blood letters go to war under a semblance of martial affectation. Favoured daemons of their packs display blood-soaked banners, under which their howling kin rend and butcher Khorne's enemies with greater ferocity.

abilities.name: Daemon

abilities.name: Icon Bearer
abilities.description: When determining control of an objective marker, treat this operative's APL characteristic as being 1 higher. Note that this is not a modifier.

uniqueActions.name: Daemonic Icon
uniqueActions.description: Until the end of the Turning Point, while this operative is within 3' of a friendly BLOODLETTER operative, that friendly operative is invigorated by Chaos. While an operative is invigorated by Chaos, improve its invulnerable save by 1.

availableDataslates.name: BLOODLETTER (HORN BEARER)
availableDataslates.description: Accompanying the Blood Legions to war, some daemons bear immense brass war horns. They use these to sound the charge, spurring their diabolical brethren on in a red tide that sweeps away the living in a sea of blood.

abilities.name: Daemon
abilities.description: This operative has a 5+ invulnerable save.

uniqueActions.name: Instrument of Chaos
uniqueActions.description: Until the end of the Turning Point, each time a friendly BLOODLETTER operative performs a Normal Move or Charge action, it can move an additional 1'.

availableDataslates.name: BLOODREAPER
availableDataslates.description: Bloodreapers marshal Khorne s frenzied hordes in battle. They are among the deadliest warriors of their kind, each having offered up countless skulls to their lord. They are not blinded by rage, and despatch their lessers with martial precision to ensure no foe escapes.

abilities.name: Daemon
abilities.description: This operative has a 5+ invulnerable save.

availableDataslates.name: DAEMONETTE (FIGHTER)
availableDataslates.description: Daemonettes are seductive harbingers of torment. They advance in a swift surge, dancing with impossible agility to pounce upon their victims with keening screams of horrific desire. They indulge in inflicting wounds with their razor-sharp claws.

abilities.name: Daemon
abilities.description: This operative has a 5+ invulnerable save.

specialRules.name: Relentless
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative fights in combat or makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that combat or shooting attack, you can re-roll any or all of your attack dice.

specialRules.name: Relentless
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative fights in combat or makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that combat or shooting attack, you can re-roll any or all of your attack dice.

availableDataslates.name: DAEMONETTE (ICON BEARER)
availableDataslates.description: The icons borne in the clawed grasp of some Daemonettes display the repulsive beauty embodied by Slaanesh. Under their baleful influence, the hedonistic daemons reach new heights of murderous excess.

abilities.name: Daemon
abilities.description: This operative has a 5+ invulnerable save.

availableDataslates.name: DAEMONETTE (HORN BEARER)
availableDataslates.description: Some Daemonettes brandish sinuous instruments that they play with lascivious exuberance. Emitting a supernatural resonance, they inflame the passions of other Daemonettes, the unnatural music goading them to more inventive debaucheries.

abilities.name: Daemon
abilities.description: This operative has a 5+ invulnerable save.

uniqueActions.name: Instrument of Chaos

availableDataslates.name: ALLURESS
availableDataslates.description: More beauteous and yet more repulsive than most Daemonettes, Alluresses orchestrate their kin's slaughter with trilling songs of praise to Slaanesh. Their hypnotic glamour causes foes to falter in their presence, helpless as barbed claws and needle-like teeth close in.

abilities.name: Daemon
abilities.description: This operative has a 5+ invulnerable save.

specialRules.name: Relentless

availableDataslates.name: PLAGUEBEARER (FIGHTER)
availableDataslates.description: A Plaguebearer's body is swollen and bursting with contagion. They shamble purposefully forward with dour inevitability, bringing the promise of corruption with them. Despite their appearance, they swing their disease-laden plagueswords with great strength.

abilities.name: Daemon
abilities.description: This operative has a 5+ invulnerable save.

abilities.name: Disgustingly Resilient
abilities.description: Each time this operative would lose a wound, roll one D6: on a 5+, that wound is not lost. Other than the effects of Battle Scars, this operative cannot be injured.

availableDataslates.name: PLAGUEBEARER (ICON BEARER)
availableDataslates.description: These daemons carry stinking icons of Nurgle into the realm of realspace, the poisonous totems dripping with pus and surrounded by clouds of fat flies. Doleful bells hang from these grim icons, tolling out the death knells of the daemon's foes.

abilities.name: Daemon
abilities.description: This operative has a 5+ invulnerable save.

abilities.name: Disgustingly Resilient
abilities.description: Each time this operative would lose a wound, roll one D6: on a 5+, that wound is not lost. Other than the effects of Battle Scars, this operative cannot be injured.

abilities.name: Icon Bearer

uniqueActions.name: Daemonic Icon
uniqueActions.description: Until the end of the Turning Point, while this operative is within 3' of a friendly PLAGUEBEARER operative, that friendly operative is invigorated by Chaos. While an operative is invigorated by Chaos, improve its invulnerable save by 1.

availableDataslates.name: PLAGUEBEARER (HORN BEARER)
availableDataslates.description: Plaguebearers utter a constant drone as they interminably tally all of Nurgle's endless diseases. Some of these fell daemons carry horns or pipes carved from rotten remains. From these, they elicit a dirge that stirs their kind into a rapid advance.

abilities.name: Daemon
abilities.description: This operative has a 5+ invulnerable save.

abilities.name: Disgustingly Resilient
abilities.description: Each time this operative would lose a wound, roll one D6: on a 5+, that wound is not lost. Other than the effects of Battle Scars, this operative cannot be injured.

uniqueActions.name: Instrument of Chaos
uniqueActions.description: Until the end of the Turning Point, each time a friendly PLAGUEBEARER operative performs a Normal Move or Charge action, it can move an additional 1'.

availableDataslates.name: PLAGUERIDDEN
availableDataslates.description: Despite their death's head rictus grins, Plagueridden are devoted to the serious business of spreading Nurgle's bounteous plagues across reality. They often bear signs of Nurgle's favour - such as more elaborate horns - and direct other Plaguebearers in his grand plans.

abilities.name: Daemon
abilities.description: This operative has a 5+ invulnerable save.

abilities.name: Disgustingly Resilient
abilities.description: Each time this operative would lose a wound, roll one D6: on a 5+, that wound is not lost. Other than the effects of Battle Scars, this operative cannot be injured.

availableDataslates.name: PINK HORROR (FIGHTER)
availableDataslates.description: Pink Horrors are magic made manifest. They caper and whirl, cackling as bolts of raw sorcery leap from their clawed fingertips. These coruscating streams of multicoloured flame do not merely burn, they turn their victims into hideous or nonsensical forms.

abilities.name: Daemon
abilities.description: This operative has a 5+ invulnerable save.

availableDataslates.name: PINK HORROR (ICON BEARER)
availableDataslates.description: Either held at the end of one gangling limb, or sprouting from the daemon's own flesh, favoured Pink Horrors carry a sorcerous icon ofTzeentch. Some of these devices burn with multi-hued fire, or twist into new shapes as their bearers gibber arcane litanies.

abilities.name: Daemon
abilities.description: This operative has a 5+ invulnerable save.

abilities.name: Icon Bearer
abilities.description: When determining control of an objective marker, treat this operative's APL characteristic as being 1 higher. Note that this is not a modifier.

uniqueActions.name: Daemonic Icon
uniqueActions.description: Until the end of the Turning Point, while this operative is within 3' of a friendly PINK HORROR operative, that friendly operative is invigorated by Chaos. While an operative is invigorated by Chaos, improve its invulnerable save by 1.

availableDataslates.name: PINK HORROR (HORN BEARER)
availableDataslates.description: Some Pink Horrors carry shimmering horns, often in the serpentine form of Tzeentch's own sigil. The daemons sound them at random moments, emitting mutating rhythms, streams of nebulous fire or other strange discharges that send their kind wild with delight.

abilities.name: Daemon
abilities.description: This operative has a 5+ invulnerable save.

uniqueActions.name: Instrument of Chaos
uniqueActions.description: Until the end of the Turning Point, each time a friendly PINK HORROR operative performs a Normal Move or Charge action, it can move an additional 1'.

availableDataslates.name: PINK HORROR IRIDESCENT
availableDataslates.description: Iridescent Horrors are imbued with a sliver of Tzeentch's immortal knowledge. They revel in leading their capering daemons in enacting Tzeentch's schemes.

abilities.name: Daemon
abilities.description: This operative has a 5+ invulnerable save.

availableDataslates.name: BLUE HORROR
availableDataslates.description: Should a Pink Horror be cut down, it may split, with the two halves reforming as smaller daemons. These Blue Horrors are morose and spiteful creatures, aggressively calling on their warp-spawned powers to destroy those who dared lay their original form low.

specialRules.name: Rng 6'
specialRules.description: Range. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, only operatives within x are a valid target, x is the distance after the weapon's Rng, e.g. Rng 6'. All other rules for selecting a valid target still apply.

abilities.name: Ephemeral Daemon
abilities.description: This operative has a 6+ invulnerable save.

specialRules.name: Rng 6'
specialRules.description: Range. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, only operatives within x are a valid target, x is the distance after the weapon's Rng, e.g. Rng 6'. All other rules for selecting a valid target still apply.

availableDataslates.name: BRIMSTONE HORRORS
availableDataslates.description: Blue Horrors that are destroyed may vanish in a cloud of smoke, from which emerge two stunted Brimstone Horrors. These diminutive daemons are manifestations of pure bitterness, seeking to incinerate their enemies with burning talons and fangs.

abilities.name: Ephemeral Daemon
abilities.description: This operative has a 6+ invulnerable save.

abilities.name: Insignificant
abilities.description: Each time this operative would perform a mission action or the Pick Up action, you must subtract one additional AP to do so. This operative cannot be equipped with equipment. Note that in narrative play, this operative does not have a narrative datacard and is no longer part of your kill team after the game.

ploys.name: UNSTOPPABLE FEROCITY
ploys.description: Until the end of the Turning Point, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of melee weapons friendly KHORNE operatives are equipped with.

ploys.name: QUICKSILVER SWIFTNESS
ploys.description: Until the end of the Turning Point, each time a friendly SLAANESH operative is activated, it can perform a free Dash action during that activation.

ploys.name: GLISTENING BARRAGE
ploys.description: Until the end of the Turning Point, ranged weapons friendly TZEENTCH operatives are equipped with gain the Ceaseless special rule.

ploys.name: CONTAGION
ploys.description: Until the end of the Turning Point, while an enemy operative is Visible to and within 2' of a friendly NURGLE operative, that enemy operative is treated as being injured (only subtract 2' from its Movement characteristic as a result of being injured if it is activated within 2' of a friendly NURGLE operative).

ploys.name: WARP SURGE
ploys.description: Use this Tactical Ploy when a friendly CHAOS DAEMON operative is selected as the target of a ranged attack. Until the end of the Turning Point, each time a shooting attack is made against that friendly operative, in the Roll Defence Dice step of that shooting attack, you can re-roil any or all of your defence dice.

ploys.name: EPHEMERAL REGENERATION
ploys.description: Use this Tactical Ploy when a friendly CHAOS DAEMON operative is activated. That friendly operative regains 2D3 lost wounds.

ploys.name: SPLIT
ploys.description: Use this Tactical Ploy when a friendly PINK HORROR operative is incapacitated for 2CP, or when a friendly BLUE HORROR operative is incapacitated for 1CP.
subTexts: Before that PINK HORROR operative is removed from the killzone, set up two BLUE HORROR operatives as close as possible to that operative and not within Engagement Range of enemy operatives.
Before that BLUE HORROR operative is removed from the killzone, set up one BRIMSTONE HORRORS operative as close as possible to that operative and not within Engagement Range of enemy operatives.

In either case, set up those operatives with the same order as the previous operative (including if it was ready or activated). In narrative play, any operatives set up as a result of this Tactical Ploy are no longer part of your kill team after the game.

criticalHitSpecialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that shooting attack, if you retain any critical hits, subtract 1 from the target's APL. subText: The first time you strike with a critical hit, select one of your opponent's normal hits from that combat to be discarded
The second time you strike with a critical hit, subtract 1 from the target's APL.

equipments.name: PIERCING CLAWS
equipments.description: SLAANESH operative only. Select one claws the operative is equipped with. Add 1 to that weapon's Critical Damage characteristic and it gains the Rending critical hit rule for the battle.

equipments.name: RITUAL DAGGER
equipments.description: PINK HORROR or BLUE HORROR operative only. The operative is equipped with the following melee weapon for the battle:

specialRules.name: Balanced
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative fights in combat or makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that combat or shooting attack, you can re-roll one of your attack dice.

equipments.name: TRINKET OF FLUX
equipments.description: PINK HORROR or BLUE HORROR operative only. Select one coruscating flames or fizzing flames the operative is equipped with. Add 1 to that weapon's Damage characteristics for the battle.

availableDataslates.name: TRAITOR BRIMSTONE GRENADIER
availableDataslates.description: Brimstone Grenadiers have an unhealthy penchant for explosive slaughter, and think nothing of wielding unstable explosives capable of showering their victims with unclean alchemical acids and poisons, or even swallowing them up in roiling clouds of infernal warp sorcery.

specialRules.name: Rng 6'
specialRules.description: Range. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, only operatives within x are a valid target, x is the distance after the weapon's Rng, e.g. Rng 6'. All other rules for selecting a valid target still apply.

specialRules.name: Blast 2'
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative performs a Shoot action and selects this weapon (or, in the case of profiles, this weapon's profile), after making the shooting attack against the target, make a shooting attack with this weapon (using the same profile) against each other operative Visible to and within X of the original target - each of them is a valid target and cannot be in Cover. X is the distance after the weapon's Blast, e.g. Blast 2'. An operative cannot make a shooting attack with this weapon by performing an Overwatch action.

specialRules.name: Indirect
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the select valid target step of that shooting attack, enemy operatives are not in Cover.

specialRules.name: Limited
specialRules.description: This weapon can only be selected for use once per battle. If the weapon has a special rule that would allow it to make more than one shooting attack for an action (e.g. Blast), make each of those attacks as normal.

criticalHitSpecialRules.name: Splash 2
criticalHitSpecialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that shooting attack, for each critical hit retained, inflict x mortal wounds on the target and each other operative Visible to and within 2' of it. x is the number after the weapon's Splash, e.g. Splash 1.

abilities.name: Grenadier
abilities.description: This operative is equipped with frag and krak grenades and they do not cost any equipment points.

abilities.name: Explosive Demise
abilities.description: If this operative is incapacitated, you can use this ability. If you do so, roll one D6, subtracting 1 from the result if this operative is within Engagement Range of an enemy operative: on a 3+, each operative Visible to and within 2' of this operative suffers D3 mortal wounds.

availableDataslates.name: TRAITOR BUTCHER
availableDataslates.description: Some amongst the Militarum Traitoris shrug off their humanity altogether, taking monstrous pleasure in hacking their enemies apart at close quarters and devouring chunks of hot, bloody flesh - sometimes while their luckless victims are still screaming their last.

specialRules.name: Lethal 5+
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative fights in combat or makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that combat or shooting attack, your attack dice results of equal to or greater than x that are successful hits are critical hits, x is the number after the weapon's Lethal, e.g. Lethal 5+.

specialRules.name: Blood Offering
specialRules.description: Each time this operative fights in combat with this weapon, in the Resolve Successful Hits step of that combat, the first time you strike with a critical hit, add one Blooded token to your pool.

specialRules.name: Lethal 5+
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative fights in combat or makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that combat or shooting attack, your attack dice results of equal to or greater than x that are successful hits are critical hits, x is the number after the weapon's Lethal, e.g. Lethal 5+.

specialRules.name: Blood Offering
specialRules.description: Each time this operative fights in combat with this weapon, in the Resolve Successful Hits step of that combat, the first time you strike with a critical hit, add one Blooded token to your pool.

abilities.name: Unholy Sustenance
abilities.description: Each time this operative fights in combat, if it incapacitates the enemy operative in that combat, it regains D3 lost wounds.

availableDataslates.name: TRAITOR COMMSMAN
availableDataslates.description: Acting as the mouthpieces for their tyrannical masters, Traitor Commsmen spit relayed orders through the corrupted vox networks of Blooded kill teams, broadcasting amplified exhortations for their comrades to fight harder in the name of the blessed Octed.

uniqueActions.name: Signal
uniqueActions.description: Select one friendly BLOODED operative Visible to and within 6' of this operative. Add 1 to its APL. This operative cannot perform this action while within Engagement Range of an enemy operative.

uniqueActions.name: Sacrilegious Actuation
uniqueActions.description: You can select one friendly BLOODED operative Visible to and within 6' of this operative, remove its Blooded token (if any) and add it to your pool. It cannot be a token that operative is only treated as having. Select one friendly BLOODED operative that does not have a Blooded token that is Visible to and within 6' of this operative. Assign one Blooded token to it from your pool. This operative cannot perform this action while within Engagement Range of an enemy operative, or if you cannot assign a Blooded token.

availableDataslates.name: TRAITOR CORPSEMAN
availableDataslates.description: Having cast aside the ethics and oaths of the true medicae, these twisted field surgeons specialise in concocting potent combat stimulants. These they dole out to drive their comrades into a savage battle-frenzy, and also to control them through increasing dependency.

specialRules.name: Lethal 5+
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative fights in combat or makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that combat or shooting attack, your attack dice results of equal to or greater than x that are successful hits are critical hits, x is the number after the weapon's Lethal, e.g. Lethal 5+.

abilities.name: Regular Dosage
abilities.description: At the end of the Select a Kill Team step of the mission sequence, if this operative is selected for deployment, you can select one friendly BLOODED operative to gain a stimm effect (see below).

uniqueActions.name: Stimms
uniqueActions.description: Select one friendly BLOODED operative Visible to and within 1' of this operative, then select one of the stimm effects below. You can only select each stimm effect for each operative once per battle. This operative cannot perform this action while within Engagement Range of an enemy operative.
subText: The selected operative regains 2D3 lost wounds.
Until the end of the battle, the melee weapons the selected operative is equipped with gain the Relentless special rule.
Until the end of the battle, each time the selected operative would lose a wound, roll one D6: on a 6, that wound is not lost.

availableDataslates.name: TRAITOR ENFORCER
availableDataslates.description: Enforcers are sadistic morale officers. Some began as allegedly incorruptible Commissars, tempted or broken by diabolical artifice. Others are petty tyrants risen from the ranks and garbed mockingly in the tattered garb - or even the flayed hides - of their former masters.

specialRules.name: Rng 6'
specialRules.description: Range. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, only operatives within x are a valid target, x is the distance after the weapon's Rng, e.g. Rng 6'. All other rules for selecting a valid target still apply.

specialRules.name: Brutal
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative fights in combat with this weapon, in the Resolve Successful Hits step of that combat, your opponent can only parry with critical hits.

specialRules.name: Rng 6'
specialRules.description: Range. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, only operatives within x are a valid target, x is the distance after the weapon's Rng, e.g. Rng 6'. All other rules for selecting a valid target still apply.

specialRules.name: Brutal
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative fights in combat with this weapon, in the Resolve Successful Hits step of that combat, your opponent can only parry with critical hits.

abilities.name: Gruelling Disciplinarian
abilities.description: While a friendly BLOODED operative is Visible to and within 3' of this operative, it is not treated as being injured (only ignore the modifier to its Movement characteristic as a result of being injured if it is activated within 3' of this operative).

uniqueActions.name: Enforce
uniqueActions.description: Select one other friendly BLOODED operative that is not ready and is Visible to and within 3' of this operative. Then select one of the following:
subText: That operative can immediately perform a free Dash action.
If that operative has an Engage order, it can perform an Overwatch action.
uniqueActions.postSubText: This operative cannot perform this action while within Engagement Range of an enemy operative.

availableDataslates.name: TRAITOR FLENSER
availableDataslates.description: Even their fellow Traitor Guardsmen look askance at Flensers, who mutter and cackle as they clash their skinning blades together in anticipation of the torments they will inflict in the Dark GodsвЂ™ names. Many have died beneath their wicked knives, but few swiftly.

specialRules.name: Ceaseless
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative fights in combat or makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that combat or shooting attack, you can re-roll any or all of your attack dice results of 1.

specialRules.name: Stalk
specialRules.description: Each time this operative fights in combat with this weapon, if it is within 2' of Light or Heavy terrain, this weapon gains the Lethal 5+ special rule for that combat.

specialRules.name: Ceaseless
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative fights in combat or makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that combat or shooting attack, you can re-roll any or all of your attack dice results of 1.

specialRules.name: Stalk
specialRules.description: Each time this operative fights in combat with this weapon, if it is within 2' of Light or Heavy terrain, this weapon gains the Lethal 5+ special rule for that combat.

abilities.name: Wretched
abilities.description: This operative can perform a Charge action while it has a Conceal order. If this operative is incapacitated in combat, if you have any remaining attack dice, you can strike with one attack dice before this operative is removed from the killzone.

availableDataslates.name: TRAITOR GUNNER
availableDataslates.description: Where Imperial Guardsmen may be issued special weapons such as flamers or plasma guns, renegades claim them from their victims as trophies, bearing them as symbols of power and status. Wielding such a potent weapon assists them in offering more gory sacrifices to the Gods.

specialRules.name: Rng 6'
specialRules.description: Range. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, only operatives within x are a valid target, x is the distance after the weapon's Rng, e.g. Rng . All other rules for selecting a valid target still apply.

specialRules.name: Torrent 2'
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative performs a Shoot action or Overwatch action and selects this weapon, after making the shooting attack against the target, it can make a shooting attack with this weapon against each other valid target within x of the original target and each other, x is the distance after the weapon's Torrent, e.g. Torrent .

specialRules.name: Rng 6'
specialRules.description: Range. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, only operatives within x are a valid target, x is the distance after the weapon's Rng, e.g. Rng . All other rules for selecting a valid target still apply.

specialRules.name: Torrent 2'
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative performs a Shoot action or Overwatch action and selects this weapon, after making the shooting attack against the target, it can make a shooting attack with this weapon against each other valid target within x of the original target and each other, x is the distance after the weapon's Torrent, e.g. Torrent .

specialRules.name: AP1
specialRules.description: Armour Penetration. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, subtract x from the Defence of the target for that shooting attack, x is the number after the weapon's AP, e.g. AP1. If two different APx special rules would be in effect for a shooting attack, they are not cumulative - the attacker selects which one to use.

specialRules.name: Blast 2'
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative performs a Shoot action and selects this weapon (or, in the case of profiles, this weapon's profile), after making the shooting attack against the target, make a shooting attack with this weapon (using the same profile) against each other operative Visible to and within X of the original target - each of them is a valid target and cannot be in Cover. X is the distance after the weapon's Blast, e.g. Blast 2'. An operative cannot make a shooting attack with this weapon by performing an Overwatch action.

specialRules.name: Rng 6'
specialRules.description: Range. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, only operatives within x are a valid target, x is the distance after the weapon's Rng, e.g. Rng 6'. All other rules for selecting a valid target still apply.

specialRules.name: AP2
specialRules.description: Armour Penetration. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, subtract x from the Defence of the target for that shooting attack, x is the number after the weapon's AP, e.g. AP1. If two different APx special rules would be in effect for a shooting attack, they are not cumulative - the attacker selects which one to use.

criticalHitSpecialRules.name: MW4
criticalHitSpecialRules.description: Mortal wounds. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the roll attack dice step of that shooting attack, for each critical hit retained, inflict x mortal wounds on the target, x is the number after the weapon's MW, e.g. MW3.

specialRules.name: AP2
specialRules.description: Armour Penetration. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, subtract x from the Defence of the target for that shooting attack, x is the number after the weapon's AP, e.g. AP1. If two different APx special rules would be in effect for a shooting attack, they are not cumulative - the attacker selects which one to use.

specialRules.name: Hot
specialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that shooting attack, for each attack dice result of 1 that is discarded, that operative suffers three mortal wounds.

specialRules.name: AP1
specialRules.description: Armour Penetration. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, subtract x from the Defence of the target for that shooting attack, x is the number after the weapon's AP, e.g. AP1. If two different APx special rules would be in effect for a shooting attack, they are not cumulative - the attacker selects which one to use.

availableDataslates.name: TRAITOR OGRYN
availableDataslates.description: Savage brutes even before turning traitor, Ogryns sworn to Chaos are quick to earn mutant blessings through their strength and savagery. However, they are slow-witted and easily exploited as bodyguards, living shields or crude line breakers by their more cunning Human comrades.

criticalHitSpecialRules.name: Rending
criticalHitSpecialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative fights in combat or makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that combat or shooting attack, if you retain any critical hits you can retain one normal hit as a critical hit.

criticalHitSpecialRules.name: Stun
criticalHitSpecialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that shooting attack, if you retain any critical hits, subtract 1 from the target's APL. Each time a friendly operative fights in combat with this weapon, in the Resolve Successful Hits step of that combat:
subText: The first time you strike with a critical hit, select one of your opponent's normal hits from that combat to be discarded
The second time you strike with a critical hit, subtract 1 from the target's APL.

criticalHitSpecialRules.name: Rending
criticalHitSpecialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative fights in combat or makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that combat or shooting attack, if you retain any critical hits you can retain one normal hit as a critical hit.

criticalHitSpecialRules.name: Stun
criticalHitSpecialRules.description: Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the Roll Attack Dice step of that shooting attack, if you retain any critical hits, subtract 1 from the target's APL. Each time a friendly operative fights in combat with this weapon, in the Resolve Successful Hits step of that combat:
subText: The first time you strike with a critical hit, select one of your opponent's normal hits from that combat to be discarded
The second time you strike with a critical hit, subtract 1 from the target's APL.

abilities.name: Avalanche of Muscle
abilities.description: Each time this operative finishes a Charge action, select one enemy operative within Engagement Range of it to suffer D3 mortal wounds.

abilities.name: Chem-enhanced
abilities.description: You can ignore any or all modifiers to this operative's APL and it is not affected by the Stun critical hit rule.

abilities.name: Brute
abilities.description: This operative cannot perform mission actions or the Pick Up action. Unless otherwise specified, this operative cannot be equipped with equipment.

availableDataslates.name: TRAITOR SHARPSHOOTER
availableDataslates.description: Skilled marksmen are often scorned by the Blooded for their unwillingness to seek glory at close quarters. Yet Sharpshooters know their own worth, offering up the departed souls of each new victim as they pick them off with their long-las.

specialRules.name: Silent
specialRules.description: While an operative has a Conceal order, it can perform Shoot actions if this is the ranged weapon (or weapon profile) that is selected for the shooting attack(s).

criticalHitSpecialRules.name: MW1
criticalHitSpecialRules.description: Mortal wounds. Each time a friendly operative makes a shooting attack with this weapon, in the roll attack dice step of that shooting attack, for each critical hit retained, inflict x mortal wounds on the target, x is the number after the weapon's MW, e.g. MW3.

criticalHitSpecialRules.name: MW1
